context.structure: Monorepo with Flutter mobile app and Node.js backend
context.recent_work: Fixed Railway deployment, Flutter migration completed

beta-readiness-review-2025-11-13.summary: Completed comprehensive beta-readiness review of PitPulse monorepo. Identified that backend is live and functional, Flutter migration is complete with auth screens, but critical Android configuration items missing (INTERNET permission, release signing, package name). iOS not configured. Existing beta checklist is outdated.
outcomes: Documented that beta checklist needs updating

reasoning_chains.thought: Analyzing project structure: Monorepo with Flutter mobile (version 1.0.0+1) and Node.js/TypeScript backend (version 1.0.0). Recent work focused on deployment fixes. Need to verify beta-readiness against the existing checklist.
reasoning_chains.reasoning: Understanding the current state before making recommendations. The project has a comprehensive beta checklist already created, so I need to verify which items have been completed and which remain.

reasoning_chains.thought: Critical finding: The existing beta checklist is outdated. It references an Android/Kotlin app, but the project has been migrated to Flutter. The Flutter app already points to a production Railway backend URL.
reasoning_chains.reasoning: The beta checklist in docs/BETA_RELEASE_CHECKLIST.md needs to be updated to reflect the Flutter migration. Many of the Android-specific steps (like ProGuard, keystore for .aab, package name changes) are now Flutter-specific concerns.

reasoning_chains.thought: Critical issue found: AndroidManifest.xml is missing INTERNET permission. This will prevent the Flutter app from making API calls to the backend.
reasoning_chains.reasoning: Without INTERNET permission in AndroidManifest, the app cannot make network requests. This is a blocking issue for beta release. Must be added before any testing.

insights.insight: Flutter projects require both AndroidManifest.xml and Info.plist updates for network permissions, unlike native apps where these are often scaffolded by default
insights.source: Beta readiness review of PitPulse Flutter migration
insights.applicability: All Flutter projects that need network connectivity must explicitly add INTERNET permission to AndroidManifest.xml and configure App Transport Security in Info.plist
